intro: Cussonia capuroniana, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 50 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red berries that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Cussonia capuroniana is valued for its ornamental leaves and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
